faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.a1: Image generation (4 images) costs 20 credits. 4K upscaling costs 10 credits per image.
faq.q2: What is the credit validity period?
faq.a2: Subscription credits are granted monthly and valid for 30 days (no rollover). Purchased credits never expire.
faq.q3: What happens if I cancel my subscription?
faq.a3: You can continue using the service until the end of your billing period. Subscription credits expire after 30 days, but purchased credits never expire.
faq.a4: Full refunds are available within 7 days of purchase if no credits have been used. Please see our refund policy for details.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: FlowCoder ("Company") values the privacy of users of the FlowStudio service ("Service") and protects personal information in accordance with the Personal Information Protection Act and related laws.

article1.title: Article 1 (Purpose of Processing Personal Information)
article1.intro: The Company processes personal information for the following purposes. Personal information will not be used for purposes other than those listed below, and prior consent will be obtained if the purpose of use changes.
article1.item1: Member Registration and Management: Verification of membership registration, identification and authentication for member services, maintenance and management of membership status, prevention of fraudulent use of services
article1.item2: Service Provision: AI image generation service, customized service provision, content provision, identity verification
article1.item3: Marketing and Advertising: Development of new services and customized services, provision of event and promotional information, verification of service effectiveness
article1.item4: Grievance Handling: Identity verification of complainants, confirmation of complaints, notification of processing results

article2.title: Article 2 (Retention and Use Period of Personal Information)
article2.intro: The Company processes and retains personal information within the retention period agreed upon when collecting personal information from the data subject or within the retention period under the law.
article2.item2: Generated Images and Content: Until deletion request or membership withdrawal
article2.item4: Payment Records: 5 years under the Electronic Commerce Act

article3.title: Article 3 (Personal Information Items Processed)
requiredItems: Access logs, IP address, cookies, service usage records
autoItems: Images and prompt data generated during service use

article4.title: Article 4 (Provision of Personal Information to Third Parties)
article4.intro: The Company does not provide users' personal information to third parties in principle. However, the following cases are exceptions:
article4.item1: When the user has given prior consent
article4.item2: When required by law or when requested by investigative agencies in accordance with legal procedures and methods
article4.thirdPartyItem: Google LLC (Vertex AI): API service provision for AI image generation

article5.title: Article 5 (Entrustment of Personal Information Processing)
article5.intro: The Company entrusts personal information processing to the following external parties for service improvement:
article5.item1: Vercel Inc.: Web hosting and server operation
article5.item2: Supabase Inc.: Database management and file storage

article6.title: Article 6 (Rights and Obligations of Data Subjects and Exercise Methods)
article6.intro: Users can exercise the following rights as data subjects:
article6.item2: Request for correction if there are errors
article6.outro: The above rights can be exercised through writing, telephone, or email to the Company, and the Company will take action without delay.

article7.title: Article 7 (Marketing Use and Advertising Information Transmission)
article7.notice: With user consent, the Company may use personal information for marketing purposes as follows:
article7.item1: Use of images generated by users as promotional and marketing materials (after de-identification)
article7.item2: Transmission of advertising information such as new service announcements, event information, and promotions to users' email addresses
article7.item3: Analysis of usage patterns for service improvement
article7.outro: Users can withdraw their consent for marketing at any time, and upon withdrawal, marketing use of related information will be immediately suspended.

article8.title: Article 8 (Measures for Security of Personal Information)
article8.intro: The Company takes the following measures to ensure the security of personal information:
article8.item1: Administrative Measures: Establishment and implementation of internal management plans, employee training
article8.item2: Technical Measures: Encryption of personal information, installation of security programs, access control management
article8.item3: Physical Measures: Restriction of physical access through use of cloud services

article10.title: Article 10 (Changes to Privacy Policy)
article10.content: This privacy policy may be amended with additions, deletions, or modifications due to changes in laws, policies, or security technology. Changes will be announced through notices within the service at least 7 days before implementation.

article11.title: Article 11 (Data Processing for AI Service Use)
article11.notice: This service is an AI-based image generation service, and we disclose data processing matters in accordance with the Framework Act on AI Development and Trust Building.
article11.item1: Data Transfer for AI Processing: Data such as prompts (text) and reference images entered by users when using the service are transmitted to external AI service providers (Google Vertex AI) for AI image generation.
article11.item2: Scope of Data Use: Transmitted data is used only for image generation purposes and is not used for AI model training.
article11.item3: AI Output Marking Information: The Company may include the following information in AI outputs in accordance with relevant laws:
article11.item3Sub2: Metadata such as generation date and service name
article11.item4: Non-identifying Information: Marking information included in AI outputs does not identify individuals and is included for legal compliance.

addendum.title: Addendum
addendum.item1: This privacy policy is effective from January 1, 2026.
addendum.item2: The provisions of Article 11 (Data Processing for AI Service Use) regarding the Framework Act on AI Development and Trust Building shall become effective on January 22, 2026, when the relevant law comes into force.

article1.title: Article 1 (Purpose)
article1.content: These terms and conditions are intended to regulate the rights, obligations, and responsibilities of the Company and users in using the FlowStudio service ("Service") provided by FlowCoder ("Company").

article2.title: Article 2 (Definitions)
article2.item1: "Service" means the AI-based image generation platform and related services provided by the Company.
article2.item2: "User" means members and non-members who use the Service in accordance with these terms.
article2.item3: "Member" means a person who has registered for the Service and has been assigned a user ID.
article2.item4: "Content" means images, text, and other creative works generated through the Service.
article2.item5: "Credits" means virtual currency used for image generation within the Service.
article2.item6: "AI Output" means images, text, and other results generated using the AI technology of this Service.
article2.item7: "AI Marking" means watermarks, metadata, or other identification marks attached to AI outputs in accordance with the Framework Act on AI Development and Trust Building.

article3.title: Article 3 (Effect and Modification of Terms)
article3.item1: These terms become effective when posted on the service screen or announced through other methods.
article3.item2: The Company may modify these terms to the extent that it does not violate relevant laws and regulations.
article3.item3: When the terms are changed, the Company will announce the effective date and reasons for the change at least 7 days before the effective date. However, changes unfavorable to users will be announced at least 30 days in advance.
article3.item4: If users do not agree to the changed terms, they may stop using the Service and withdraw.

addendum.title: Addendum
addendum.item1: These terms are effective from January 1, 2026.
addendum.item2: The obligation provisions of Chapter 9 (AI Outputs and Legal Compliance) regarding the Framework Act on AI Development and Trust Building shall become effective on January 22, 2026, when the relevant law comes into force.
